channel.title: ::Commands?
channel.description:
I've been working on my very first server, I downloaded the Ags Pking source, every time I typed in ::commands.. It would lag me out.
So I went into Client.Java and completely took out the whole thing.
I was just wondering if anyone has the code to a working ::commands, so it will open and show the list of commands I code in.
Thanks! :)

item.title: ::Commands?
item.dc:creator: @bobbykinney000 bobbykinney000
item.description:
@bobbykinney000 wrote:

the ly reason you get 100 errors is because you placed the “{” in the wrong place or didnt place it at all.

it should look something like this

} else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“rules”)) {
MainHelpMenu();

then edit the mainhelpmenu part of it by searching for the mainhelpmenu() in the client.java and editing it.

Read full topic

item.title: ::Commands?
item.dc:creator: @Aleksander Aleksander
item.description:
@Aleksander wrote:

yea, I pasted the ::rules code… It works and everything, but when I tried to change the name to ::commands… It came up as 100 errors.

Read full topic

item.title: ::Commands?
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“Aleksander, post:3, topic:291459”]I tried that.

After I compiled, it said that I had over 100 errors. :([/quote]

Paste the code.

item.title: ::Commands?
item.dc:creator: @bobbykinney000 bobbykinney000
item.description:
@bobbykinney000 wrote:

why dont you just find the ::rules command you have and find the window that brings up and copy and paste it and then make a ::commands command that brings up your copy of the ::rules command list and you can just go into your copyed ::rules command and edit it to bring up the commands instead

Read full topic
